required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prostaglandins Use Before Mirena IUD Insertion in Prev CS Women During Lactational Amenorrhea
clinical_study.official_title: Prostaglandins Use Before Mirena IUD Insertion in Prev CS Women During Lactational Amenorrhea

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective randomized controlled study to determine the effect of prostaglandin intake before Mirena IUD insertion It was conducted at the Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology, Kasr El-Ainy Teaching Hospital, Faculty of Medicine, Cairo University,

detailed_description.textblock: The study aiming to measure the estimate difficulty of insertion of the Mirena IUD by using prostaglandins 2 hours before the procedure and the effect of prostaglandins to make this procedure easy with other side effects and complications as bleeding perforation, nausea, vomiting, failure of insertion and comparing them with a placebo group who didn't receive prostaglandins

primary_outcome.measure: Difficulty of insertion of Mirena IUD by using the Ease of Insertion score graduated as VAS like scale
primary_outcome.description: By using the visual analogue score

secondary_outcome.description: need for cervical dilatation to pass the IUD

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain at insertion according to VAS
secondary_outcome.description: By using the visual analogue score

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective sensation of satisfaction graduated as VAS like scale
secondary_outcome.description: By using the visual analogue score like system

secondary_outcome.measure: side effects during IUD insertion: bleeding, vasovagal reaction, cramps, nausea, perforation, vomiting
secondary_outcome.description: Bleeding by using the soaked bads

secondary_outcome.measure: side effects after 24 hrs of IUD insertion: nausea, vomiting, cramps and hyperthermia
side effects after 30 days of IUD insertion: spotting, cramps, acute PID and expulsion

secondary_outcome.description: From start of procedure till removing the speculum

clinical_study.condition: to Study the Estimate Difficulty of Insertion Mirena IUD With Use of Prostaglandins

arm_group.description: this group will receive 200 mcg prostaglandins in form of misoprostol 2 hrs before mirena iud insertion
this group will receive placebo tablet before mirena iud insertion

intervention.description: misoprostol 200 mcg will be given sublingual 2 hrs before mirena iud insertion

study_pop.textblock: female patients during the lactational amenorrhea who undergo Mirena IUD insertion after had been delivered by CS within 6 monthes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1- Women in lactational amenoeehea with pregnancy test negative 2- Women who had caesarean section within 6 monthes of IUD insertion 3- No medical disorders
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1- Women in regular menses 2- Medical disorders 3- Nulligravida or muligravida with NVD 4- Women with history of Previous CS more than one CS 5- Any congenital uterine anomalies, fibroids and adenomysis 6- Chronic pelvic pain 7- Intrauterine adhesions 8- Spasmodic dysmenohrrea 9- Allergy to misoprostol
